title: [K-12] Computer-Based Learning Simulation for Critical Literacy Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic reading comprehension skills and experience analyzing college-level texts
context.additional_context: VR simulation-based project learning feasible in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Identify logical fallacies, biases, and rhetorical strategies in diverse text genres with 80% accuracy
Select and apply five or more context-appropriate reading comprehension strategies based on text type

Using collaborative tools like Google Docs or Padlet, learners can receive feedback from three or more peers, incorporate it into a 500-character critical analysis report, and meet two or more of the three evaluation criteria (clarity, logical coherence, creativity).
Visualize argument structures for simulated social issue texts in VR environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
